The village is well known for having the first Butlins holiday camp and the home of the large family amusement park, Fantasy Island. The local authority is East Lindsey District Council. Prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries. No fixtures and fittings will be warranted with this sale and an inventory cannot be provided. The property is being 'sold as seen' and any items left on the day of completion will be inherited by the purchaser excluding any third party items.  Ground Floor Footprint - c. 5,101 ft² Total site area – c 0.544 acres (Measurements are taken from digital mapping and are approximate). The Rateable Value of the Cherry Tree has been assessed at £16,750 (2023).

displayAddress: Front Street, Winlaton, Blaydon on Tyne, NE21 6AB
propertySubType: Alternate Use, Bar, Takeaway, Leisure, Investment, Restaurant, Other, Retail, Cafe, Public House
detailedDescription: A mid terrace property of stone construction rendered and painted to all elevations under a tile roof. The pub has a large open plan bar and seating area, comprising of both fixed and loose seating. To the right of the bar is a large pool table and dart board area which houses the pubs sports teams throughout the week and has flat screen TV's for live sports games. Through the seating area and to the left, you will find a rear snug area leading out to the smoking area and car park. The snug is scattered with high stools and tables, making it the perfect spot for vertical drinking.  The living accommodation is located on the first floor and briefly comprises of Kitchen, Bathroom, Lounge and 3 Bedrooms. The pub is situated in Winlaton, on the main High Street, near Blaydon-on-Tyne. Blaydon is well-connected by road, with the A1 motorway nearby, and it has a railway station providing access to Newcastle and other destinations. Winlaton's front street is the village's forefront for shopping, as it has a variety of shops, public houses and takeaways. We are advised that the property is not listed or in a flood zone No fixtures and fittings will be warranted with this sale and an inventory cannot be provided. The property is being 'sold as seen' and any items left on the day of completion will be inherited by the purchaser excluding any third party items such as beer raising equipment. Total site area is 0.058 Acres. The footprint of the building extends to 2,206 Sq ft (Measurements Taken From a Digital Mapping System) The April 2023 rateable value has been assessed at £12,000. Small business rates relief may apply and suggest interested parties make their own enquires to Gateshead Council.

displayAddress: Farmers Way, Droitwich Spa, Worcestershire, WR9 9EQ
propertySubType: Restaurant, Public House, Bar, Leisure
detailedDescription: The Fox & Goose is a two and single storey detached property of brick elevations beneath pitched tiled and flat roofs. The accommodation briefly comprises an entrance hall providing access to the large open plan bar area. The bar area has seating for approximately 70, with a timber bar servery, high beamed ceiling, raised area with stone built corner fireplace, fixed perimeter seating and pool area.  A timber, jointed dividing panel leads to the rear lounge bar with approximately 30 covers, a timber bar servery, part tiled and carpeted flooring, arts area and rear entrance hall. The Ladies and Gents W.C.s are accessed from the internal hallway, which also serves as a side entrance hall. The Fox & Goose also benefits from a small commercial kitchen to the rear of the bar servery, a spacious ground floor beer cellar and store, small office, staff W.C. and cleaning store.  The domestic accommodation is located over the 1st floor, accessed via a private staircase, and briefly comprises a large lounge, domestic kitchen, bathroom, one double bedroom and two single bedrooms.  To the exterior the pub pub benefits from a car park, accessed from Farmers Way, providing approximately 16 spaces, a private rear yard and a paved terrace area to the front of the property providing an outdoor drinking area and picnic bench seating or 12. The Fox & Goose is prominently located in the centre of the Westlands estate, just to the north west of Droitwich Spa town centre. The Fox & Hounds is the only public house on the densely populated estate and is very close to the A38 which, in turn, provides quick and easy access to the M5 motorway. Droitwich Spa (often abbreviated to Droitwich) is a historic spa town in the Wychavon district in northern Worcestershire. The town is located on the River Salwarpe approximately 22 miles (35 km) south-west of Birmingham and 7 miles (11 km) north-east of Worcester. Droitwich shopping is mainly focused in the traditional town centre around Victoria Square, leading to the St Andrew's Square shopping centre and down to the original High Street, with its local pubs and an eclectic mix of traditional shops. As at the 2021 census, the population of Droitwich Spa was 25,027. We are advised that the property is neither Listed nor situated within a Conservation Area. Prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries. No fixtures and fittings will be warranted with this sale and an inventory cannot be provided. The property is being 'sold as seen' and any items left on the day of completion will be inherited by the purchaser excluding any third party items such as games machines or beer raising equipment. The Property is let on a 99 Year FRI Lease from May 1972. The lease is free of all product ties, with rent reviews every 7th year of the term. The current annual rent is £18,000, paid quarterly in advance.  Rateable Value of the Fox & Goose has been assessed at £5,150 (2023).The premises may qualify for Small Business Rates Relief in which case the non-domestic rating liability may be nil subject to the ratepayer occupying only one property for the purposes of business.

propertySubType: Retail, Leisure, Bar, Land / Development, Restaurant, Public House
detailedDescription: The Markham Arms is a two storey detached property of brick elevations beneath pitched tiled and flat roofs. Internally, the accommodation briefly comprises a front entrance hall leading to a pool/sports room on the right, with bar servery, upholstered perimeter seating, and access to Ladies & gents W.C.s . To the left of the entrance hall is the Lounge bar with approximately 40 covers and a timber bar servery and perimeter seating. A door from the lounge bar leads to an inner hallway with a further set of Ladies & gents W.C.s and access to the function room. The function room has seating for approximately 50, with a timber bar servery, upholstered perimeter seating and a raised stage with two dressing rooms off.  The pub also benefits from an extensive basement beer cellar and various store rooms.  The domestic accommodation is situated over the first floor, with a separate access and briefly comprises three bedrooms, (2x Double; 1x Single), lounge, bathroom and a domestic kitchen. Externally, the pub has a lawned and covered paved patio area with picnic bench seating for approximately 40, and a small children's play area to the side with artificial grass surface. An enclosed car park, laid to tarmac, is to the rear and side of the pub. The Markham Arms is prominently situated on the corner of Dorset Drive and Somerset Drive within a densely populated residential estate in the Brimington area of Chesterfield.  Brimington is actually a large village and civil parish with the Borough of Chesterfield, in Derbyshire.  The population of the parish taken at the 2011 census was 8,788.The town of  Staveley is to the east, and Hollingwood is nearby. The pub lies approximately 3 miles north east of Chesterfield town centre, 10 miles south of Sheffield and 3 miles to the west of the M1 motorway.  We understand the Property is neither Listed nor situated within a conservation area. Prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries. No fixtures and fittings will be warranted with this sale and an inventory cannot be provided. The property is being 'sold as seen' and any items left on the day of completion will be inherited by the purchaser excluding any third party items such as games machines or beer raising equipment. The overall site size is c. 0.437 acres and the property has a ground floor footprint of 3,475 sq ft, (Measurements are taken from digital mapping and are approximate). Rateable Value of the Markham Arms has been assessed at £5,250. The premises may qualify for Small Business Rates Relief in which case the non-domestic rating liability may be nil subject to the ratepayer occupying only one property for the purposes of business.

displayAddress: 1, School Lane, Croxton Kerrial, Leicestershire, NG32 1QR
propertySubType: Bar, Public House, Cafe, Restaurant, Guest House
detailedDescription: The Geese & Fountain is a two storey stone and brick-built detached property beneath pitched tiled roofs, with single storey flat and pitched roof additions to the rear. The ground floor accommodation briefly consists of three connecting trading areas arranged around a timber bar servery. The Bar Area has approximately 40 covers with wooden floor and beamed ceiling, raised area with darts throw; Dining Area has an additional 20 covers with flagstone flooring and brick built feature fireplace. The Lounge area has easy chair seating for c. 20 with exposed stone walls and open feature fireplace. The pub also benefits from Ladies and Gents WCs, a commercial kitchen with wash-up area and walk in fridge and freezer units, ground floor beer cellar and bottle store. The spacious domestic accommodation is situated over the first floor and briefly comprises 5 bedrooms, lounge, office/store and bathroom, with separate W.C. The property also benefits from 7 letting bedrooms, (6x double and 1x single), which are located in separate brick-built detached building to the rear of the main pub. All rooms have ensuite facilities.  To the exterior, the pub has a paved rear courtyard, car park for up to 20 cars and a lawned area.  The Geese and Fountain is a traditional village inn directly fronting the busy A607 Melton – Grantham road in Croxton Kerrial. Croxton is a village and civil parish in the Melton borough of Leicestershire. The village is located approximately 6.6 miles (10.6 km) south-west of Grantham, 7.9 miles (12.7 km) north-east of Melton Mowbray and 0.5 miles (0.8 km) west of Leicestershire's border with Lincolnshire. Croxton Kerrial itself has a population of around 378 living within a 1km radius. The property is administrated by Melton Borough Council. We understand the property is not Listed but is situated in the Croxton Kerrial Conservation Area.  The property is being let 'as seen' and any items left on the day of completion will be inherited by the tenant excluding any third party items. The total site area is approximately 0.771 acres and the ground floor footprint (GEA) extends to 4,660 ft2. Measurements are taken from digital mapping and are approximate. Rental offers are invited for a new Free of Tie commercial lease. The new lease will be either 10 or 20 years, on a Fully Repairing and Insuring basis, with 5 year rent reviews to OMV and annual RPI uplifts capped at 5% and collared at 2.5%. VAT will be payable on the rent. The Lease may be assigned after the end of the first two years. The equivalent of six months’ rent is required as a deposit. A contribution to Landlord's legal fees of £1,500 will be payable. The Rateable Value of the property is £8,000 (2023).

propertySubType: Bar, Guest House, Cafe, Takeaway, Public House, Restaurant, Alternate Use
detailedDescription: Front entrance leading directly into main bar with horseshoe servery, open fireplace. Can seat approx 20 customers (including bar seating). Ladies WC and access to lobby and 2nd entrance from the front. Extensive dinning/function room. Currently used as a sports bar area. Could seat up to 30 customers. Conservatory overlooking patio garden with seating for approx 12 customers. Lounge bar to the left of the main entrance with extended servery. Seating for up to 20 customers. Access to Gents WC. All customer areas are traditionally decorated throughout and kept in good condition. Equipped trade kitchen with prep and wash up area. Several dry storage rooms. Ground floor cellar.  1st floor private accommodation consists of 3 bedrooms, lounge, bathroom and kitchen. Internal access only. External areas consist of an enclosed patio beer garden to the rear, with covered smoking shed. Area could seat up to 40 customers.  The Lord Nelson is a prominent 2 storey corner property located in a dense residential area of North Gorleston in Norfolk, just a few minutes from the popular seaside resort of Great Yarmouth.  The A47 is just one minute away, with road links to Great Yarmouth, Norwich, Lowestoft and Kings Lynn.  Gorleston-on-Sea lies just to the south of Great Yarmouth with its own huge bay and riverside and a stunning sandy beach stretching into the distance below cliff gardens and a grand promenade. TripAdvisor has named Gorleston as number one in the Best Beaches in the UK and twelfth on the Best European Beaches. The glorious beach is a firm favourite with locals and visitors for lazy days in the sun, it's also one of the best destinations in the Great Yarmouth area if windsurfing, surfing or body-boarding is your preferred seaside activity. The property is not listed and is not situated within a Conservation Area Those looking to purchase for alternative use are asked to make their own enquiries regarding possible planning via  Great Yarmouth Council The trade fixtures and fittings, including the kitchen, are available to purchase at a separate cost following a valuation by an accredited third party.  Site area - 0.169 acres Total Floor Area - 4,370 sq ft Freehold with benefit of vacant possession looking for offers in the region of £250,000 (plus VAT). The property is being 'sold as seen' and all parties are asked to carry out their own due diligence before submitting an offer. Our clients will not consider any offers that are subject to any planning, house or business sales. Rateable Value - £10,000 as of 1st April 2023.
